https://prez.dev/description.@value: The status of a borehole when it is being constructed, from its spud date to its rig release date [after QLD for ‘construction’ (= altLabel ‘Drilling’); similar to ‘drilling’ (GSWA Borehole Status, April 2023), but until the borehole has reached its intended target/depth zone. Also, (1) cf. Geoscience Australia (2021) for ‘in progress’: ‘The status of a borehole commencing from the rig being moved onsite to the time that drilling operations are completed’, likened by GA to PPDM's (2014) ‘drilling’ term, now equivalent to PPDM’s (2020) ‘constructing’ facet value; and (2) cf. NZ for ‘active’: A well is considered active from the commencement of drilling through to the well being completed and capable of fulfilling its intended purpose].
The subject is an instance of a class.
The defininition of the subject resource.
An idea or notion; a unit of thought
Relates a concept to a concept that is more general in meaning
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept

skos:exactMatch is used to link two concepts, indicating a high degree of confidence that the concepts can be used interchangeably across a wide range of information retrieval applications. skos:exactMatch is a transitive property, and is a sub-property of skos:closeMatch
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included
Relates a concept to a concept that is more specific in meaning
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language

The stage of a borehole in relation to the lifecycle of the borehole, from proposal and operational stages through to completion and rehabilitation, and with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. The vocabulary focuses on standard terminology from the energy and mineral resources sectors, highlighting instances where the same term carries different meaning in different fields. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium). Note that the currency of borehole status data in GSWA's databases is time-stamped, reflecting information gathered from a borehole operator’s well completion report or from a responsible regulatory authority at a specific point in time; subsequent changes are unlikely to be recorded.
A stage referring to the collection of activities that specifically occur while a borehole is being drilled, from groundbreaking to reaching the intended depth/zone.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The status of a borehole commencing from the rig being moved onsite up until the time that drilling is completed. Note that this stage does not include any operations at the drillsite and within the borehole that follow the completion of drilling the hole. Note that this corresponds to the status of 'drilling' in the PPDM Wellbore Status vocabulary 2014.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition adapted from Geoscience Australia's Borehole Status vocabulary (in turn modified from PPDM Wellbore Status vocabulary, 2014, and CoalLog).

https://prez.dev/description.@value: The status of a borehole commencing from the rig being moved onsite up until the time that drilling is completed. Note that this stage does not include any operations at the drillsite and within the borehole that follow the completion of drilling the hole. Note that this corresponds to the status of 'drilling' in the PPDM Wellbore Status vocabulary 2014.
The status of a borehole commencing from the rig being moved onsite to the time that drilling operations are completed.  Similar to PPDM's "drilling", but different.
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc
